metadata.title: CVE-2019-17026 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Incorrect alias information in IonMonkey JIT compiler for setting arrayelements could lead to a type confusion. We are aware of targeted attacksin the wild abusing this flaw. This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR <68.4.1, Thunderbird < 68.4.1, and Firefox < 72.0.1.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-17026` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 72.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 72.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 72.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:68.4.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:68.4.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:68.4.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:68.4.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:68.4.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:68.4.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '72.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
thunderbird package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:68.4.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
mozjs38: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
mozjs52: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
